result.execSummary:
The defendant Jovanni M Walls was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jovanni M Walls in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for return on warrant.  The Defendant has not been complying with probation.  The Court ordered the 10-day stay of condition time be LIFTED.  Defendant is taken into custody and ordered to serve 10 days, straight time, in the House of Correction with NO GOOD TIME.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant, Jovanni M Walls, does not appear in court.  Joanne Hardtke for Catelin Ringersma appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Jill Brezobar appears for the Department of Corrections.

Matter here for a probation review hearing.  The Defendant is not compliant with probation.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Court Memo from Probation Officer Jill Brezovar, received and filed.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 12-03-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jovanni M Walls in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum, appearing for Catelin Ringersma, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by the State, Defense counsel and defendant.

As to Count 1:
Court sentenced defendant to serve 6  MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence with straight time; credit for 24 days served. 

As to Count 2:
Court sentenced defendant to serve 6  MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence with straight time; credit for Zero (0) days served. 

As to both counts:
Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 1 year (each count concurrent to each other) with the following conditions:
- Serve 10 days in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence.  Condition time is STAYED to December 24, 2015 pending probation review hearing.
- No Contact Order with Lori N-H  AND/OR  her residence
- Obtain/Maintian Employment  and/or be enrolled and attending school - or a combination of work and school - a minimum of 40 hours a week
- Perform 50 hours of community service (each count concurrent to each other)
- DNA sample and pay the surcharge during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Attend the probation review hearing on December 3, 2015

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

JusticePoint Pretrial Report dated September 9, 2015 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report (GPS violation-Inclusion) received and filed.  bm
with attached Restitution Worksheet filed by ADA Catelin Ringersma on behalf of the State.

Defendant Jovanni M Walls in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 AMENDED to two misdemeanors as follows:

Count #1:  Theft [a Class A MISDEMEANOR], contrary to Wisc, Stats. Sec. 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a).
Count #2:  Theft [a Class A MISDEMEANOR], contrary to Wisc, Stats. Sec. 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a).

**NO AMENDED INFORMATION FILED.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.   Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Court addressed the Justice Point Violation:  Defendant received a violation for failure to charge the GPS battery.  Court admonished defendant for receiving the violation.  Court does not modify bail or conditions of release at this time.

Parties request a sentencing date.
Court GRANTS request.

ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.

Case adjourned to 09-10-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 8:30 AM - Br. 30, Judge Conen's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
FILED, Justice Point Report with attached Violation Report.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services "Violation" Report; received and filed.  (GPS Violation - Battery.)
JusticePoint Pretrial Services "Violation" Report; received and filed.  (GPS Violation - Battery.)

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 06-01-2015 received and filed. (12 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Public Defender Stephen Sargent 819 N 6th.

15RM029158  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06-12-15

Court MODIFIED bail to $500.00 cash with TURNOVER TO:  Justice Point Pretrial Electronic Monitoring (GPS) Program for supervision.  Conditions of release:  (1) 24-hour curfew EXCEPT for attorney appointments and school if verified by Justice Point.  All other conditions previously ordered remain the same.
Justice Point Pretrial Electronic Monitoring (GPS) Order; signed and filed.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Jovanni M Walls not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court addressed bail:  Defense motion to modify bail argued and GRANTED.  Court MODIFIED bail to $500.00 cash with TURNOVER TO:  Justice Point Pretrial Electronic Monitoring (GPS) Program for supervision.  Conditions of release:  (1) 24-hour curfew EXCEPT for attorney appointments and school if verified by Justice Point.  All other conditions previously ordered remain the same.

Case adjourned to 07-23-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Scheduling Conference.
COURT ORDERS OTHER TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF BAIL TO REMAIN THE SAME.

Steve Sargent appears with defendant for bail motion.  
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail is AMENDED TO $1,000.00 CASH.

Defendant Jovanni M Walls in court with attorney Louis Epps for Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jovanni M Walls in custody.  Joanne Hardtke for Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Julian Nunez-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Lauri NH or her residence.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jovanni M Walls in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jovanni M Walls in custody.  
Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
